text.section:
A circuit court or the District Court may:
impose a sentence for a specified time and provide that a lesser time be served in confinement;
suspend the remainder of the sentence; and
order probation for a time longer than the sentence but, subject to subsections (b) and (c) of this section, not longer than:
if a defendant convicted of sexual abuse of a minor under § 3-602 of the Criminal Law Article or a crime involving a minor under § 3-303, § 3-304, § 3-305, § 3-306, or § 3-307 of the Criminal Law Article, consents in writing, order probation for a time longer than the sentence that was imposed on the defendant, but not longer than:

section.section:
For the purpose of making restitution, the court may extend the probation beyond the time allowed under subsection (a)(3)(i) of this section for:
an additional 5 years if the probation is ordered by a circuit court; or
an additional 3 years if the probation is ordered by the District Court.
An extension of probation under this subsection may be unsupervised or supervised by the Division of Parole and Probation.

text.section:
The court may extend the probation beyond the time allowed under subsection (b) of this section if:
the defendant consents in writing; and
the extension is only for making restitution.

section.section: For the purpose of a commitment to the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene for treatment under § 8-507 of the Health - General Article, the court may extend the probation for 1 year beyond the time allowed under subsection (a)(3)(i) of this section.
An extension of probation under this subsection shall be supervised by the Division of Parole and Probation.

text.section:
The court may extend the probation beyond the time allowed under subsection (d) of this section only if:
the defendant consents in writing; and
the extension is only for a commitment to the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene for treatment under § 8-507 of the Health - General Article.
